original: 10 Indriyayamaka
analyzed: indriya yamaka
translated: The Twin Dhamma Talk on Faculties

original: 10.3 Pariññāvāra🔽10.3.6. Atītānāgatavāra
analyzed: pariññāvāra
translated: The Chapter on Full Understanding🔽… The Chapter on the Past and Future

original: 10.3.6.1. Anuloma🔽Yo cakkhundriyaṁ parijānittha so domanassindriyaṁ pajahissatīti? No.
analyzed: anuloma  yaḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānittha saḥ domanassindriyam pajahissati iti no
translated: … The Direct Way🔽“Those who fully understand the eye faculty: do they abandon the faculty of grief?” “No.”

original: Yo vā pana domanassindriyaṁ pajahissati so cakkhundriyaṁ parijānitthāti? No.🔽Yo cakkhundriyaṁ parijānittha so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvessatīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana domanassa indriyam pajahissati saḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānittha ati no  yaḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānittha saḥ anaññātaññassāmīti indriyam bhāvessati iti no
translated: “Or do those who abandon the faculty of grief fully understand the eye faculty?” “No.”🔽“Those who fully understand the eye faculty: do they develop the faculty of final knowledge?” “No.”

original: Yo vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvessati so cakkhundriyaṁ parijānitthāti? No.🔽Yo cakkhundriyaṁ parijānittha so aññindriyaṁ bhāvessatīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam bhāvessati saḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānittha ati no  yaḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānittha so aññindriyam bhāvessati iti no
translated: “Or do those who develop the faculty of final knowledge fully understand the eye faculty?” “No.”🔽“Those who fully understand the eye faculty: do they develop the faculty of final knowledge?” “No.”

original: Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ bhāvessati so cakkhundriyaṁ parijānitthāti? No.🔽Yo cakkhundriyaṁ parijānittha so aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissatīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam bhāvessati saḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānittha ati no  yaḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānittha saḥ aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissati iti no
translated: “Or do those who develop the faculty of final knowledge fully understand the eye faculty?” “No.”🔽“Those who fully understand the eye faculty: do they realize the faculty of final knowledge?” “No.”

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissati so cakkhundriyaṁ parijānitthāti? No. (Cakkhundriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissati saḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānittha ati no
translated: “Or do those who realize the faculty of final knowledge fully understand the eye faculty?” “No.” (Eye faculty.)

original: Yo domanassindriyaṁ pajahittha so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvessatīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ domanassa indriyam pajahittha saḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam bhāvessati iti no
translated: “Those who have abandoned the faculty of sorrow … the faculty of coming to know the unknown … the faculty of final knowledge?”

original: Yo vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvessati so domanassindriyaṁ pajahitthāti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana anaññātaññassāmi itindriyam bhāvessati saḥ domanassindriyam pajahittha ati no
translated: “Those who will develop the faculty of final knowledge … the faculty of final knowledge?”

original: Yo domanassindriyaṁ pajahittha so aññindriyaṁ bhāvessatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ domanassindriyam pajahittha saḥ aññindriyam bhāvessati iti
translated: “Those who have abandoned the faculty of sorrow will realize the fruit of arahantship?”

original: Dve puggalā domanassindriyaṁ pajahittha, no ca aññindriyaṁ bhāvessanti. Anāgāmī domanassindriyañca pajahittha aññindriyañca bhāvessati.
analyzed: dve puggalā domanassindriyam pajahittha no ca aññindriyam bhāvessanti anāgāmī domanassindriyam ca pajahittha aññindriyam ca bhāvessati
translated: Two persons have abandoned the faculty of sorrow but will not realize the fruit of arahantship. The nonreturner has abandoned the faculty of sorrow and will realize the fruit of arahantship.

original: Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ bhāvessati so domanassindriyaṁ pajahitthāti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam bhāvessati saḥ domanassindriyam pajahittha ati
translated: “Those who will realize the fruit of arahantship will have abandoned the faculty of sorrow?”

original: Cha puggalā aññindriyaṁ bhāvessanti, no ca domanassindriyaṁ pajahittha. Anāgāmī aññindriyañca bhāvessati domanassindriyañca pajahittha.
analyzed: cha puggalāḥ aññindriyam bhāvessanti no ca domanassindriyam pajahittha anāgāmī aññindriyam ca bhāvessati domanassindriyam ca pajahittha
translated: Six persons will realize the fruit of arahantship but will not have abandoned the faculty of sorrow. The nonreturner will realize the fruit of arahantship and will have abandoned the faculty of sorrow.

original: Yo domanassindriyaṁ pajahittha so aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ domanassa indriyam pajahittha saḥ aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissati iti
translated: “Those who have abandoned the faculty of sorrow will realize the fruit of arahantship?”

original: Arahā domanassindriyaṁ pajahittha, no ca aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissati. Dve puggalā domanassindriyañca pajahittha aññātāvindriyañca sacchikarissanti.
analyzed: arahā domanassindriyam pajahittha no ca aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissati dve puggalā domanassindriyam ca pajahittha aññātāvindriyam ca sacchikarissanti
translated: The Worthy One abandons the sorrow faculty, but does not realise the final knowledge faculty. Two kinds of persons abandon the sorrow faculty and realise the final knowledge faculty.

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissati so domanassindriyaṁ pajahitthāti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissati saḥ domanassindriyam pajahittha ati
translated: Or, does anyone who realises the final knowledge faculty abandon the sorrow faculty?

original: Cha puggalā aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissanti, no ca domanassindriyaṁ pajahittha.
analyzed: cha puggalāḥ aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissanti no ca domanassindriyam pajahittha
translated: Six kinds of persons realise the final knowledge faculty, but do not abandon the sorrow faculty.

original: Dve puggalā aññātāvindriyañca sacchikarissanti domanassindriyañca pajahittha. (Domanassindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: dve puggalā aññātau indriyañca sacchikarissanti domanassa indriyañca pajahittha domanassa indriya mūlaka
translated: Two kinds of persons realise the final knowledge faculty and abandon the sorrow faculty. (The sorrow faculty.)

original: Yo anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvittha so aññindriyaṁ bhāvessatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ anaññātaññassāmi itindriyam bhāvittha saḥ aññindriyam bhāvessati iti
translated: Does anyone who develops the ‘I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown’ faculty develop the final knowledge faculty?

original: Dve puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvittha, no ca aññindriyaṁ bhāvessanti. Pañca puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca bhāvittha aññindriyañca bhāvessanti.
analyzed: dve puggalāḥ anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam bhāvittha no ca aññindriyam bhāvessanti pañca puggalāḥ anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam ca bhāvittha aññindriyam ca bhāvessanti
translated: Two kinds of persons develop the ‘I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown’ faculty, but do not develop the final knowledge faculty. Five kinds of persons develop the ‘I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown’ faculty and also develop the final knowledge faculty.

original: Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ bhāvessati. So anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvitthāti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam bhāvessati saḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam bhāvittha ati
translated: Or who will develop the other faculty? Has he developed the faculty of final knowledge?

original: Dve puggalā aññindriyaṁ bhāvessanti no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvittha. Pañca puggalā aññindriyañca bhāvessanti anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca bhāvittha.
analyzed: dve puggalāḥ aññindriyam bhāvessanti no ca anaññātaññassāmi itindriyam bhāvittha pañca puggalāḥ aññindriyam ca bhāvessanti anaññātaññassāmi itindriyam ca bhāvittha
translated: Two persons will develop the other faculty but have not developed the faculty of final knowledge. Five persons will develop the other faculty and have developed the faculty of final knowledge.

original: Yo anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvittha so aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ an aññāta ñassāmi iti indriyam bhāvittha saḥ aññātau indriyam sacchikarissati iti
translated: Will he who has developed the faculty of final knowledge realize the faculty of final knowledge?

original: Arahā anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvittha, no ca aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissati. Cha puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca bhāvittha aññātāvindriyañca sacchikarissanti.
analyzed: arahā anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam bhāvittha no ca aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissati cha puggalāḥ anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam ca bhāvittha aññātāvindriyañca sacchikarissanti
translated: The arahant has developed the faculty of final knowledge but will not realize the faculty of final knowledge. Six persons have developed the faculty of final knowledge and will realize the faculty of final knowledge.

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissati so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvitthāti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātau indriyam sacchikarissati saḥ anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam bhāvittha ati
translated: Or who will realize the faculty of final knowledge has he developed the faculty of final knowledge?

original: Dve puggalā aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissanti, no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvittha.
analyzed: dve puggalā aññātau indriyam sacchikarissanti no ca anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam bhāvittha
translated: Two persons will realize the faculty of final knowledge but have not developed the faculty of final knowledge.

original: Cha puggalā aññātāvindriyañca sacchikarissanti anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca bhāvittha.
analyzed: cha puggalā aññātau indriyañca sacchikarissanti
translated: Six persons: they will make the faculty of final knowledge to arise and they will develop the faculty of ‘I shall come to know the as yet unknown.’

original: (Anaññātaññassāmītindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yo aññindriyaṁ bhāvittha so aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissatīti? No.
analyzed: an añña a taññaḥ sāmi iti indriya mūlaka  yaḥ aññindriyam bhāvittha saḥ aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissati iti no
translated: (The Triplets based on the faculty of ‘I shall come to know the as yet unknown.’)🔽Is anyone who develops the faculty of final knowledge making the faculty of final knowledge to arise? No.

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissati so aññindriyaṁ bhāvitthāti? No. (Aññindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissati saḥ aññindriyam bhāvittha ati no aññindriya mūlaka
translated: Or is anyone who makes the faculty of final knowledge to arise developing the faculty of final knowledge? No.

original: 10.3.6.2. Paccanīka
analyzed: paccanīka
translated: (The Triplets based on the faculty of final knowledge.)🔽… in reverse order

original: Yo cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānittha so domanassindriyaṁ nappajahissatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānittha saḥ domanassindriyam na ppajahissati iti
translated: Is anyone who has not fully understood the eye faculty one who has not abandoned the faculty of grief?

original: Pañca puggalā cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānittha, no ca domanassindriyaṁ nappajahissanti. Cattāro puggalā cakkhundriyañca na parijānittha domanassindriyañca nappajahissanti.
analyzed: pañca puggalā cakkhu indriyam na parijānittha no ca domanassindriyam na pajahissanti cattāro puggalā cakkhu indriyam ca na parijānittha domanassindriyam ca na pajahissanti
translated: Five persons have not fully understood the eye faculty but have not abandoned the faculty of grief. Four persons have not fully understood the eye faculty and have not abandoned the faculty of grief.

original: Yo vā pana domanassindriyaṁ nappajahissati so cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānitthāti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana domanassindriyam na pajahissati saḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānittha ati
translated: Or is anyone who has not abandoned the faculty of grief one who has not fully understood the eye faculty?

original: Arahā domanassindriyaṁ nappajahissati, no ca cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānittha. Cattāro puggalā domanassindriyañca nappajahissanti cakkhundriyañca na parijānittha.
analyzed: arahā domanassindriyam na pajahissati no ca cakkhundriyam na parijānittha cattāro puggalā domanassindriyam ca na pajahissanti cakkhundriyam ca na parijānittha
translated: Arahants do not abandon the sorrow faculty, but they have fully understood the eye faculty. Four persons do not abandon the sorrow faculty and have not fully understood the eye faculty.

original: Yo cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānittha so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessatīti?🔽Ye puthujjanā maggaṁ paṭilabhissanti te cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānittha, no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ
analyzed: yaḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānittha saḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvessati iti  ye puthujjanāḥ maggam paṭilabhissanti te cakkhu indriyam na parijānittha no ca
translated: “Those who have not fully understood the eye faculty will not develop the final-knowledge faculty”:

original: na bhāvessanti. Aṭṭha puggalā cakkhundriyañca na parijānittha anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāvessanti.
analyzed: na bhāvessanti aṭṭha puggalā cakkhu indriyañca na parijānittha anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāvessanti
translated: those ordinary people who obtain the path have not fully understood the eye faculty, but they will develop the final-knowledge faculty. Eight persons have not fully understood the eye faculty and will not develop the final-knowledge faculty.

original: Yo vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessati so cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānitthāti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvessati saḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānittha ati
translated: “But those who will not develop the final-knowledge faculty have they not fully understood the eye faculty?”

original: Arahā anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessati, no ca cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānittha. Aṭṭha puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāvessanti cakkhundriyañca na parijānittha.
analyzed: arahā anaññātaññassāmīti indriyam na bhāvessati no ca cakkhundriyam na parijānittha aṭṭha puggalāḥ anaññātaññassāmīti indriyam ca na bhāvessanti cakkhundriyam ca na parijānittha
translated: Arahants do not develop the final-knower faculty, but they do not not fully understand the eye faculty. Eight persons do not develop the final-knower faculty and do not fully understand the eye faculty.

original: Yo cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānittha so aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānittha saḥ aññindriyam na bhāvessati iti
translated: Those who do not fully understand the eye faculty, do they not develop the final-knower faculty?

original: Satta puggalā cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānittha, no ca aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessanti. Dve puggalā cakkhundriyañca na parijānittha aññindriyañca na bhāvessanti.
analyzed: satta puggalā cakkhundriyam na parijānittha no ca aññindriyam na bhāvessanti dve puggalā cakkhundriyam ca na parijānittha aññindriyam ca na bhāvessanti
translated: Seven persons do not fully understand the eye faculty, but they do not not develop the final-knower faculty. Two persons do not fully understand the eye faculty and do not develop the final-knower faculty.

original: Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessati so cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānitthāti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam na bhāvessati saḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānittha ati
translated: But those who do not develop the final-knower faculty, do they not fully understand the eye faculty?

original: Arahā aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessati, no ca cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānittha. Dve puggalā aññindriyañca na bhāvessanti cakkhundriyañca na parijānittha.
analyzed: arahā aññindriyam na bhāvessati no ca cakkhundriyam na parijānittha dve puggalā aññindriyam ca na bhāvessanti cakkhundriyam ca na parijānittha
translated: Arahants do not develop the final-knower faculty, but they do not not fully understand the eye faculty. Two persons do not develop the final-knower faculty and do not fully understand the eye faculty.

original: Yo cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānittha so aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānittha saḥ aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissati iti
translated: Those who do not fully understand the eye faculty, do they not realize the final-knower faculty?

original: Aṭṭha puggalā cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānittha, no ca aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissanti.🔽Ye puthujjanā maggaṁ na paṭilabhissanti te cakkhundriyañca na parijānittha aññātāvindriyañca
analyzed: aṭṭha puggalā cakkhu indriyam na parijānittha no ca aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissanti  ye puthujjanāḥ maggam na paṭilabhissanti te cakkhu indriyam ca na parijānittha aññātāvindriyam ca
translated: Eight persons have not fully understood the eye faculty, but they will not not realize the final knowledge.

original: na sacchikarissanti.
analyzed: na sacchikarissanti
translated: Those ordinary men who will not obtain the path have not fully understood the eye faculty and they will not realize the final knowledge.

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissati so cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānitthāti?🔽Arahā aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissati, no ca cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānittha. Ye🔽puthujjanā maggaṁ na paṭilabhissanti te aññātāvindriyañca na sacchikarissanti cakkhundriyañca
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissati saḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānittha ati  arahā aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissati no ca cakkhu indriyam na parijānittha ye  puthujjanāḥ maggam na paṭilabhissanti te aññātāvindriyam ca na sacchikarissanti cakkhu indriyam ca
translated: Or, whoever will not realize the final knowledge, has he not fully understood the eye faculty?

original: na parijānittha. (Cakkhundriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: na parijānittha cakkhu indriya mūlaka
translated: The Arahant will not realize the final knowledge, but he has fully understood the eye faculty. Those ordinary men who will not obtain the path will not realize the final knowledge and they have not fully understood the eye faculty. (Eye faculty.)

original: Yo domanassindriyaṁ nappajahittha so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ domanassindriyam na ppajahittha saḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvessati iti
translated: Whoever has not abandoned the sorrow faculty, does he not develop the final-knowledge-of-the-unknowing faculty?

original: Ye puthujjanā maggaṁ paṭilabhissanti te domanassindriyaṁ nappajahittha, no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ
analyzed: ye puthujjanāḥ maggam paṭilabhissanti te domanassindriyam nappajahittha no ca
translated: Those ordinary men who will obtain the path have not abandoned the sorrow faculty, but they will develop the final-knowledge-of-the-unknowing faculty.

original: na bhāvessanti. Cha puggalā domanassindriyañca nappajahittha anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāvessanti.
analyzed: na bhāvessanti cha puggalā domanassindriyañca na ppajahittha anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāvessanti
translated: six persons do not abandon the faculty sorrow and do not arouse the faculty of understanding what has not been understood.

original: Yo vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessati so domanassindriyaṁ nappajahitthāti?🔽Tayo puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessanti, no ca domanassindriyaṁ nappajahittha.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvessati saḥ domanassindriyam na ppajahittha ati  tayo puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvessanti no ca domanassindriyam na ppajahittha
translated: Or, does anyone who does not arouse the faculty of understanding what has not been understood not abandon the faculty sorrow?🔽Three persons do not arouse the faculty of understanding what has not been understood, but they do not abandon the faculty sorrow.

original: Cha puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāvessanti domanassindriyañca nappajahittha.
analyzed: cha puggalāḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāvessanti domanassindriyañca na ppajahittha
translated: Six persons do not arouse the faculty of understanding what has not been understood and do not abandon the faculty sorrow.

original: Yo domanassindriyaṁ nappajahittha so aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessatīti?🔽Cha puggalā domanassindriyaṁ nappajahittha, no ca aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessanti. Ye
analyzed: yaḥ domanassindriyam na pajahittha saḥ aññindriyam na bhāvessati iti  cha puggalā domanassindriyam nappajahittha no ca aññindriyam na bhāvessanti ye
translated: Does anyone who does not abandon the faculty sorrow not arouse the faculty of understanding?🔽Six persons do not abandon the faculty sorrow, but they do not not arouse the faculty of understanding.

original: puthujjanā maggaṁ na paṭilabhissanti te domanassindriyañca nappajahittha aññindriyañca na bhāvessanti.
analyzed: puthujjanāḥ maggam na paṭilabhissanti te domanassindriyam ca na pajahittha aññindriyam ca na bhāvessanti
translated: Those ordinary persons who do not obtain the path do not abandon the faculty sorrow and do not arouse the faculty of understanding.

original: Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessati so domanassindriyaṁ nappajahitthāti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam na bhāvessati saḥ domanassindriyam na ppajahittha ati
translated: Or, does anyone who does not arouse the faculty of understanding not abandon the faculty sorrow?

original: Dve puggalā aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessanti, no ca domanassindriyaṁ nappajahittha. Ye
analyzed: dve puggalā aññindriyam na bhāvessanti no ca domanassindriyam na ppajahittha ye
translated: Two persons do not cultivate the Final-knower faculty, but they do not abandon the grief faculty.

original: puthujjanā maggaṁ na paṭilabhissanti te aññindriyañca na bhāvessanti domanassindriyañca nappajahittha.
analyzed: puthujjanāḥ maggam na paṭilabhissanti te aññindriyam ca na bhāvessanti domanassindriyam ca na pajahittha
translated: Those who are worldlings and do not obtain the path do not cultivate the Final-knower faculty and do not abandon the grief faculty.

original: Yo domanassindriyaṁ nappajahittha so aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissatīti?🔽Cha puggalā domanassindriyaṁ nappajahittha, no ca aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissanti.
analyzed: yaḥ domanassindriyam na pajahittha saḥ aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissati iti  cha puggalā domanassindriyam na ppajahittha no ca aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissanti
translated: “Those who do not abandon the grief faculty, do they not realize the Final-knower faculty?”🔽Six persons do not abandon the grief faculty, but they do realize the Final-knower faculty.

original: Ye puthujjanā maggaṁ na paṭilabhissanti te domanassindriyañca nappajahittha aññātāvindriyañca🔽na sacchikarissanti.
analyzed: ye puthujjanāḥ maggam na paṭilabhissanti te domanassa indriyam ca na pajahittha aññātāvindriyañca  na sacchikarissanti
translated: Those who are worldlings and do not obtain the path do not abandon the grief faculty and do not realize the Final-knower faculty.

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissati so domanassindriyaṁ nappajahitthāti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissati saḥ domanassindriyam na ppajahittha ati
translated: “But those who do not realize the Final-knower faculty, do they not abandon the grief faculty?”🔽The arahat does not realize the Final-knower faculty, but he does abandon the grief faculty.

original: Arahā aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissati, no ca domanassindriyaṁ nappajahittha. Ye
analyzed: arahā aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissati no ca domanassindriyam na pajahittha ye
translated: Those who are worldlings and do not obtain the path do not realize the Final-knower faculty and do not abandon the grief faculty.

original: puthujjanā maggaṁ na paṭilabhissanti te aññātāvindriyañca na sacchikarissanti domanassindriyañca
analyzed: puthujjanāḥ maggam na paṭilabhissanti te aññātāvindriyam ca na sacchikarissanti domanassindriyam ca
translated: Ordinary people who do not obtain the path will not realize the faculty of final knowledge and will not abandon the faculty of sorrow.

original: nappajahittha. (Domanassindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: na ppajahittha domanassindriya mūlaka
translated: (The faculty of sorrow is the root.)

original: Yo anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvittha so aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessatīti?🔽Dve puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvittha, no ca aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessanti.🔽Ye puthujjanā maggaṁ na paṭilabhissanti te anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāvittha
analyzed: yaḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvittha saḥ aññindriyam na bhāvessati iti  dve puggalāḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvittha no ca aññindriyam na bhāvessanti  ye puthujjanāḥ maggam na paṭilabhissanti te na
translated: “Those who do not develop the faculty of final knowledge as final knowledge will not develop the faculty of final knowledge.”🔽Two persons do not develop the faculty of final knowledge as final knowledge, but they will develop the faculty of final knowledge.

original: aññindriyañca na bhāvessanti.
analyzed: aññindriyam ca na bhāvessanti
translated: Ordinary people who do not obtain the path will not develop the faculty of final knowledge as final knowledge and will not develop the faculty of final knowledge.

original: Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessati so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvitthāti?🔽Dve puggalā aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessanti, no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvittha.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam na bhāvessati saḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvittha ati  dve puggalāḥ aññindriyam na bhāvessanti no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvittha
translated: “Or, those who do not develop the faculty of final knowledge will not develop the faculty of final knowledge as final knowledge?”🔽Two persons do not develop the faculty of final knowledge, but they do develop the faculty of final knowledge as final knowledge.

original: Ye puthujjanā maggaṁ na paṭilabhissanti te aññindriyañca na bhāvessanti anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāvittha.
analyzed: ye puthujjanāḥ maggam na paṭilabhissanti te aññ indriyam ca na bhāvessanti anaññātaññassāmi itindriyam ca na bhāvittha
translated: Ordinary people who do not obtain the path will not develop the faculty of final knowledge and will not develop the faculty of final knowledge as final knowledge.

original: Yo anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvittha so aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ anaññātaññassāmi itindriyam na bhāvittha saḥ aññātau indriyam na sacchikarissati iti
translated: “Anyone who does not develop the faculty of final knowledge will not realize the fruit of final knowledge?”

original: Dve puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvittha, no ca aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissanti.
analyzed: dve puggalā anaññātaññassāmi itindriyam na bhāvittha no ca aññātau indriyam na sacchikarissanti
translated: There are two kinds of persons who do not develop the faculty of final knowledge but who will realize the fruit of final knowledge.

original: Ye puthujjanā maggaṁ na paṭilabhissanti te anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāvittha
analyzed: ye puthujjanāḥ maggam na paṭilabhissanti te na
translated: There are those ordinary persons who will not obtain the path. They do not develop the faculty of final knowledge

original: aññātāvindriyañca na sacchikarissanti.
analyzed: aññātau indriyam ca na sacchikarissanti
translated: and they will not realize the fruit of final knowledge.

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissati so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvitthāti?🔽Arahā aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissati, no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvittha.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātau indriyam na sacchikarissati saḥ anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam na bhāvittha ati  arahā aññātau indriyam na sacchikarissati no ca anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam na
translated: “Or anyone who will not realize the fruit of final knowledge does not develop the faculty of final knowledge?”🔽A perfected being will not realize the fruit of final knowledge but he does develop the faculty of final knowledge.

original: Ye puthujjanā maggaṁ na paṭilabhissanti te aññātāvindriyañca na sacchikarissanti
analyzed: ye puthujjanāḥ maggam na paṭilabhissanti te aññātau indriyam ca na sacchikarissanti
translated: There are those ordinary persons who will not obtain the path. They will not realize the fruit of final knowledge

original: anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāvittha. (Anaññātaññassāmītindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: anaññātaññassāmi itindriyañca na bhāvittha anaññātaññassāmi itindriya mūlaka
translated: and they do not develop the faculty of final knowledge. (The section based on the faculty of final knowledge.)

original: Yo aññindriyaṁ na bhāvittha so aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissatīti?🔽Aṭṭha puggalā aññindriyaṁ na bhāvittha, no ca aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissanti.
analyzed: yaḥ aññindriyam na bhāvittha saḥ aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissati iti  aṭṭha puggalāḥ aññindriyam na bhāvittha no ca aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissanti
translated: “Whoever does not develop the final-knower faculty will not realize the final-knower faculty?”🔽Eight persons do not develop the final-knower faculty, but they will realize the final-knower faculty.

original: Ye puthujjanā maggaṁ na paṭilabhissanti te aññindriyañca na bhāvittha aññātāvindriyañca🔽na sacchikarissanti.
analyzed: ye puthujjanāḥ maggam na paṭilabhissanti te aññindriyañca na bhāvittha aññātāvindriyañca  na sacchikarissanti
translated: Those ordinary persons who will not obtain the path will not develop the final-knower faculty, and they will not realize the final-knower faculty.

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissati so aññindriyaṁ na bhāvitthāti?🔽Arahā aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissati, no ca aññindriyaṁ na bhāvittha. Ye puthujjanā🔽maggaṁ na paṭilabhissanti te aññātāvindriyañca na sacchikarissanti aññindriyañca
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissati saḥ aññindriyam na bhāvittha ati  arahā aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissati no ca aññindriyam na bhāvittha ye puthujjanā  maggam na paṭilabhissanti te aññātāvindriyam ca na sacchikarissanti aññindriyam ca
translated: “But whoever will not realize the final-knower faculty, will he not develop the final-knower faculty?”

original: na bhāvittha. (Aññindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Pariññāvāro.🔽Indriyayamakapāḷi niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: na bhāvittha aññindriya mūlaka  pariññāvāro
translated: A perfected one will not realize the final-knower faculty, but he will develop the final-knower faculty. Those ordinary persons who will not obtain the path will not realize the final-knower faculty, and they will not develop the final-knower faculty.🔽(The section based on the final-knower faculty.)🔽The section on full understanding.

original: Yamakapakaraṇaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: yamaka pakaraṇam niṭṭhita
translated: The chapter on pairs is finished.🔽The pairs are finished.
